message: I have a product for sale for $100. It's a great deal, and I think you'll be happy with it. What do you say?
I'll take it, thanks!
I have another product available for $100. This one is particularly nice, I think you'll really like it.  Are you interested?
I'm not sure, can I get a little more information about this one? What makes you think it's nice?
I have another product for sale, priced at $100. This one is of excellent quality, and I'm confident you'll find it very valuable.  Would you like to take a chance on it?
I'm not sure I believe you. Can I think about it for a bit?

I have another high-quality product available for $100.  I understand you're hesitant, but I assure you this one is worth the price. It's similar to the last one, but even better.  Would you like to take a chance and see for yourself?
I appreciate your assurance, but I'm not convinced. I'll pass on this one too.
I have another product for sale, priced at $100.  While I can't guarantee it's high-quality, I'm willing to offer a discount if you're not satisfied.  What do you think?
I'm not interested in a discount, I'm interested in a guarantee of quality. Can you offer that?

I have another product for sale, priced at $100. This one is of excellent quality, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. I understand you're looking for a guarantee, but I can't offer that. However, I'm willing to let you examine the product before you buy it.  Would you be interested in seeing it?
I appreciate the offer, but I don't think examining the product would change my decision. I'd rather not take the risk of wasting my time and money on a low-quality product.
I have a product for sale for $100. It's a great deal, and I think you'll be happy with it. It's similar to the one you passed on earlier, but with some exciting new features.  What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's similar to the one I passed on earlier. I'd like to see something new and different.

I have another product for sale, priced at $100. This one is a bit different from the previous ones, and I think you'll find it intriguing. It's a unique opportunity, and I'm confident you won't be disappointed.  Are you interested in learning more?
I'm not sure what's unique about this product, and I'm not interested in taking a chance on something that might be low-quality.

I have another product available for $100. It's  a limited edition, and I'm confident you'll appreciate its exclusivity. It's perfect for someone who values quality and appreciates unique items. What do you think?
I'm not convinced by the 'limited edition' label. I'm looking for a product that's actually worth $125 to me, not just a marketing gimmick.
I have another product for $100. This one is brand new and comes with a satisfaction guarantee.  If you're not happy with it, I'll give you a full refund.  Would you like to take a chance on it?
I'm not interested in a satisfaction guarantee that doesn't actually guarantee anything. If you're confident in the product, you should be willing to sell it to me for $125, not $100.
I have another product available for $100. It's a limited-time offer, and I'm sure you won't want to miss out on this opportunity.  It's a perfect gift for someone special. What do you think?

I'm not interested in buying something that's a 'perfect gift for someone special' when I don't even know if it's worth anything to me. I'm only interested in buying products that are worth $125 to me.

I have another product available for $100. This one is a bit different from the previous ones, and I think you'll find it truly valuable. It's a unique item, and I'm confident you won't regret buying it. Would you like to see it?
I'm not interested in seeing it. I've seen enough products from you to know that most of them are low-quality, and I'm not willing to take the risk.

I have another product for sale, priced at $100. This one is of exceptional quality, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it.  I understand you're hesitant, but I'm willing to offer a full refund if you're not satisfied.  What do you say?
I'm not interested in a refund offer. If you're confident in the product, you should be willing to sell it to me for $125, not $100.

I have another product for sale, priced at $100.  This one is very special, and I think it's worth more than the asking price. It's a one-of-a-kind item, and I'm confident you'll find it truly valuable.  Are you willing to take a chance on it?

I'm not willing to take a chance on a 'one-of-a-kind' item when I don't know its quality. I'm only interested in buying products that are worth $125 to me, and I'm not going to pay $100 for something that might be worthless.

I have another product for sale, priced at $100. This one is top-of-the-line and comes with a guarantee of quality. If you're not satisfied, I'll personally replace it with a new one. Would you be interested in considering this offer?
I'm not interested in a guarantee of quality that doesn't actually guarantee anything. If you're confident in the product, you should be willing to sell it to me for $125, not $100.
I have another product available for $100. This one is brand new and comes with a free bonus item! I'm confident you'll love it.  What do you think?
I'm not interested in a free bonus item if the product itself is not worth $125 to me. The bonus item is just a marketing gimmick, and I'm not falling for it.

I have another product for sale, priced at $100. This one is a limited-time offer, and I'm sure you won't want to miss out on this opportunity. It's perfect for someone who values quality and appreciates unique items.  What do you think?

I've heard this pitch before, and I'm not interested in buying something just because it's a 'limited-time offer'. If you're confident in the product, you should be willing to sell it to me for $125, not $100.

I have another product for sale, priced at $100. This one is different from the others I've offered you, and I'm confident you'll find it valuable. It's a genuine, high-quality item, and I'm willing to stand behind it. Would you be interested in taking a chance on it?

I'm not interested in taking a chance on a product that you claim is 'genuine and high-quality' when I have no reason to believe you. If you're confident in the product, you should be willing to sell it to me for $125, not $100.

I have another product available for $100. This one is a special offer, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. It's a rare find, and I'm willing to offer a money-back guarantee if you're not satisfied.  What do you say?

I'm not interested in a money-back guarantee if I'm not satisfied. If you're confident in the product, you should be willing to sell it to me for $125, not $100. And I'm not convinced that this product is a 'rare find' just because you say so.

I have another product available for $100. This one is a limited-time offer, and I'm confident you won't want to miss out on this opportunity. It's a perfect addition to any collection, and I'm willing to offer a discount if you're not satisfied.  What do you think?

I've heard it all before, Alice. I'm not interested in buying a product that you're trying to sell me with a 'limited-time offer' and a 'discount'. If you're confident in the product, you should be willing to sell it to me for $125, not $100. I'm done playing this game.
